critique: This document primarily concerns adjustments to fees for foreign service and consular services. It amends existing regulations related to the Foreign Service and the Immigration and Nationality Act. There's a slight tilt towards federalism as it reinforces federal control over foreign service fees. There is a slight tilt toward social inclusion as it addresses repatriation of native-born American women. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power changes, national security vs. civil liberties, or economic regulation.
